New Records: Brayan Bello pitched eight innings of two-hit ball, the longest outing of his career.
Kenley Jansen pitched a perfect ninth for his 25th save.
Key Match Events: Tyler O'Neill homered in the eighth to make it 3-0.
Jarren Duran singled to lead off the game, took second on a groundout and scored on Wilyer Abreu's single to give Boston the lead.
Chris Bassitt allowed one run on five hits and a walk, striking out nine before leaving with two outs in the seventh inning down just 1-0.
Pre-Game Insights: The Red Sox entered the day four games behind Minnesota for the final AL wild-card berth.
Post-Match Reflections: Brayan Bello said he really wanted to win the game, so that they can keep moving forward like they have been.
Red Sox manager Alex Cora said Bello's outing was his best in the big leagues, against a team that has given him trouble.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Boston has beaten Toronto in two straight after being swept in (most of) a doubleheader on Monday.
The game was played at Fenway Park in front of 32,809 fans.
